pros: It's all about support. NOVA's culture of supporting students who are often in difficult circumstances extends to the community of people who work there. *The work is rewarding; You feel you are contributing to something important. * Most everyone is focused on doing a good job teaching; teachers are not competitive with one another * Every term, when NOVA's schedule changed, management gave me hours that worked with the rest of my life.
cons: The pay could be better. This is not a place to make a lot of money.

pros: friendly, welcoming, clean, spacious, positive environment
cons: low student enrollment currently not many students to help

pros: The diversity of the student body and dedicated colleagues make NOVA a good place to work.
cons: The organization is stagnant in terms of embracing change and very little flexibility (hybrid work is very limited or not offered at all).

pros: Kind and interesting students (mainly Annandale campus) A few good employees to connect with. Good place to learn how a little power can go to people's heads. Good healthcare plans. Good amount of leave. Pay is slightly above average for higher ed BUT... (see cons)
cons: Administration is awful. HR is the worst to work with, bad at communicating, rude, and their department has no reason to support the humans who work there. Micromanagement of individuals who don't need it but lack of supervisor for awful and overpaid "special assignment" individuals. It's still an extremely racist ("white is right" and "white savior" mentality) establishment. Administration moves undesirables around as opposed to firing or placing any real consequences on the individual. Campus Administration is afraid of these individuals and do not support employees who have been victims to their temper tantrums. SWAM rules the place but food vendors are always bad and poorly priced. Many Brault admins do not have adequate experience or backgrounds for what they oversee/do. School's tag line should be, "we hope you like filling out forms." There's no place to have legitimate communication. The president has "office hours" but not all submitted questions are seen let alone answered. You can enter with one job but can eventually do the job of an entire department. Extremely poor money management. For reference the school once "misplaced" 11million $ and pays for a lot of "enrichment" for its upper admin. Not much opportunity to move up unless you are related to someone, are part of the boys club, or kiss up to the right individuals. DEI office is a joke. It was a last ditch effort to be part of a trend but executed poorly. Nobody works towards a common goal and every one competes harshly with each other.

review_title: Great place to work for as a first job
job_title: Science and Math Tutor in Annandale, VA
pros: Flexible Schedule Great Environment Not too Stressful
cons: Some Students are not fun to work with

pros: It’s flexible but they don’t pay you much and it’s a toxic hostile work environment.
cons: They treat their staff like crap and don’t appreciate anything. I highly recommend against working for the academic success center on Annandale campus. I worked there 8 years and went into debt for my job and they didn’t care. They only paid me $12/hour too.

pros: Amazing support and resources from LAS. Respectful of my time and resources. Great communication. Paid professional development.
cons: Pay is not great and enrollments are dropping.

pros: The only pro used to be the two weeks off we got for winter break, but they have reduced this to only a few days.
cons: The Office of Strategic Insights was an awful experience. Almost the entire office has quit in the past year (so far, about 13 people). A micro-managed, inflexible environment in which you are expected to itemize your entire day and provide multiple updates throughout the day regarding your progress. There is no trust at all that you are willing or capable of being productive on your own. Leadership has no idea what they're doing but will be first to blame you to save themselves or take credit for your work. Oh, and last year everyone was given a below expectations performance rating from a manager who was just hired and had only known us for 2 months.

pros: Flexible work schedule Meet new people

cons: There's a big difference in how many students show up during rush times and how many show up when it's slow, but that didn't reflect on our schedules. Sometimes you're waiting around doing nothing and other times you're trying to do the work of three other people which is pretty stressful.

pros:
*Stability
*Good work-life balance
*Some great students (about 20%)
*Autonomy; create your own syllabus and course assignments
*Can easily earn your base salary plus 50% (this is the norm for full-time faculty)
*Extra pay when enrollment is equal to 45 students after day 45 of semester (1.5 extra credits at adjunct rate)
*Can pick up 1 or 2 overload courses each semester for extra pay if desired
*Great student diversity at Alexandria and Woodbridge campuses
*Once you're hired as a full-time faculty member, you can stay in the job for 30 years if you want
*Older adults can get a job here as a faculty member
cons:
*Subtle and direct pressure to do whatever it takes, even inflating grades, to get good student evaluations
*Dean told me that he only cared about student evaluations
*One colleague gave the questions for tests, before giving the test, presumably to get good student evaluations; this was his normal practice
*Although I was able to maintain my integrity as a professor and not give in to the everybody passes pressure, everyone may not be able to do this
*Not enough space for each faculty member to have an office
*Attended a faculty retreat in which expensive consultants were hired to tell us words we should never say to students and one of the words was "no". We (faculty) all had a great laugh at this!  However, the provost, who has never been a full-time faculty member, seemed to think that this made great sense. Go figure
*Many faculty members are 60+
*More young people are needed

pros: Self development teaching, academic career counselor
cons: Department leadership in 2017 was unsatisfactory

review_title: My Work Matters But Is Not a Living Wage
pros:
Genuinely helping students

review_title: Stay Away from Northern Virginia Community College
pros: It will hire you when no one else will.  In other words, they don't care if you're good or not, they just want a warm body.  They have hired friends of friends even if those friends are not qualified for the jobs and they have promoted those people to high positions, without them paying their dues.  So if you are stupid but breathing, apply.  They'll hire you.  They don't even check references, so you can lie on  your aplication.  And if you are black, then you are definitely going to be hired, since they seem to want to hire people of color more than anyone else.  very unfair.
cons: Absolutely awful management at the top. The president is totally out of touch with the students and their needs. He doesn't even solicit their input on graduation speakers or important things like that.  The benefits are OK but morale is lower than a mole's hole.  If you want to be depressed every day, get a job at NOVA (or NVCC) or whatever they choose to call it these days.  I t hink it's NOVA.  You also have to fight to get a parking spot.  They need more parking.  And the human resources people are out of touch with today's laws and regulations.  YUCK.

pros: Very diverse community college and many opportunities
cons: No downsides so far that I have seen

pros: Things were much better three years ago but not now
cons: Adjuncts are faceless individuals in an environment where deans and department chairs have no idea who you are. Be ready to be ignored in any decisions where face to face faculty might have a say.

review_title: Would not be my first choice
pros: Working with students is inherently rewarding. The benefits are good.
cons: This organization is a huge bureaucracy which leads to lots of frustration. Each department has a singular focus without much regard to how their work impacts other departments. Plan on lots of  headaches with everything from getting a parking pass to getting paid to getting into your classroom. There is little accountability so the employees as a group are a mixed bag. I agree with a previous poster that the school has gone to such extremes trying to promote minorities that whites are at somewhat of a disadvantage when competing for promotions. The school is working on its PR and you will receive many emails about how this is one of the best community colleges. However, reviews of empirical measures (graduation rate, salaries)  would not lead one to a similar conclusion. The school is despirate for adjunct faculty and they will let anyone with a heartbeat teach as an adjunct. Morale is poor due to newer employees earning higher salaries than people who have worked for the college for 10-20+ years.

pros: professional works, friendly coworkers, learn a lot
cons: sometimes problems can be very challenging

review_title: Serious managment problems and low morale.
pros: Great benefits (for faculty), good work/life balance, working with students is rewarding
cons: Morale is very poor, this is the type of place where you do not need to do work if you do not want to, it is basically impossible to get fired. It is frustrating to see others earning the same pay doing little. Conversely there is not any reward for working hard, when there are raises they go to everyone equally or go to which ever job groups are most underpaid, they do not have anything to do with individual performance. Raises are so infrequent that new employees are often paid more than people who have been working at NOVA for 10 or 20 years which further impacts morale. Did I mention salarys are very low for northern VA. HS teachers are much better paid than teaching faculty here. Montgomery College also pays much better an average of about 10k more per year for teaching faculty.  Before working here I would suggest going to one of the campuses and talking to a few employees.

pros: Benefits are SOOOOOO great!  The College closes from December 19 and opens up on Jan 2, so you get a all that time off paid and it doesn't count against your regular vacation days.  Regular vacation days = 4 weeks.  You also get 3 personal days and 3 weeks sick leave.  In addition you get a lot of holidays throughout the year.  Also, you can take classes for free if there is an available seat.  Pay is not bad, I would say its above average but not top of the income food chain.  Supposedly a proposal was submitted that is going to give us better pay raises due to the high cost of living in Northern VA.  The people are REALLY nice.  This is a good paying, VERY STABLE job with INSANE benefits.
cons: Wish if I made more money.

job_title: Instructor, Department of English in Sterling, VA
pros: Students are great, facilities are up-to-date, new construction should increase enrollment and decrease cancelled classes. Administration is quick to answer/respond to questions and concerns and provide timely solutions to requests.
cons: Pay is abusively low, which is not unique to NVCC, but the constant push by universities to turn themselves into corporate models creates a burden on students in that their teachers are tasked with providing the same level of education at salaries well below their full-time counterparts. If an adjunct is working the equivalent full-time hours, their pay is still proportionally less than 50% of their full-time counterparts.

pros: I was a non-faculty full time staff member.  Great health insurance, and flexibility with hours. Some coworkers were wonderful. Faculty REALLY care about their students.
cons: I read some of the glassdoor reviews before accepting this job and thought "No way can it be this bad." The amount of promoting people to their level of incompetence is astounding! It would have been funny if it weren't so frustrating. Higher level staff members are difficult, always looking to say no, unwilling to support others, and all around unpleasant. No one ever gets fired because everyone is afraid that positions will disappear if they become vacant, so terrible employees are allowed to  thrive.

review_title: Great place for stability....but not for being promoted or moving up.
pros: Stability, laid-back, security of your job (for the most part). The health insurance is wonderful.
cons: Everyone makes the same amount in my department. So if you work hard or if you just show up--you still get paid the same. It can be very frustrating and difficult to stay motivated. It seems as though the best way to move up is to fit in with the "it crowd" and know someone on your hiring committee.

review_title: Great Mission , Needs Great Vision & Strategy  in Place
pros: Good people, great connections with the students and staff. Good benefits and learning opportunities (some are hard to seek out)
cons:
Disconnected  executive leadership, no clear vision for organizational structure/management 
Recycling of workers who only care about a paycheck, not the mission of the College.  Keeping ineffective staff & faculty on the payroll when its clear they are a major setback/obstacle to good service to the student mission.

pros: NOVA's teachers and administrators are a great bunch to work with. Just about everyone is supportive of everyone else. Teaching is good work; everyone wants to do a good job and do it with a smile. NOVA"s humble reputation helps, I think; you don't find arrogance on campus.
cons: Adjunct professors are paid very little. Everyone at NOVA seems to complain about being underpaid, but having gone from adjunct to part-time but real employee, I can tell you that there is underpaid and then there is underpaid, and adjuncts are severely underpaid.

review_title: Working hard to serve many constituencies
job_title: Dual Enrollment Testing & Data Coordinator in Centreville, VA
pros: The college strives to serve students and the community, many departments work together, I have encountered many wonderful people in the departments of which I have been a part.  A wonderful resource for students looking to save money on college.  Most people try really hard.
cons: The budget is very tight right now and there is not money to fund existing vacancies.  There is often little consistency between the campuses and this makes it hard for both students and staff.

pros: The majority of people that work at the college really want to serve the students.  If you want to try a variety of activities the college gives many opportunities to explore.
cons: The college administration has lost focus.  There are a ton of initiatives announced, but there is limited to no follow-thru. The morale at the college in the faculty ranks is poor because of whimsical policy changes and subpar administrators.

pros: Great work/life balance. Co-workers are friendly and are mostly team players. Great benefits and opportunities for overtime.
cons:
Manpower has always been a struggle. Classified staff positions aren't truly valued when it comes to compensation; always the last to receive a pay raise, and receive the "left-overs" from teaching/administrative faculty.
Massive struggles in HR and higher ups.
Good old boy system. If you don't have the correct ins... you won't get promoted.

review_title: Drama, heartbreak, and tragedy:  good in the theater but not the workplace
pros: There are a lot of great people to work with, including many of the students. Some students and faculty are exceptionally good, which some may find surprising at a community college.
cons: The drama:  Politics, politics, politics.  In-fighting between and within campuses.  The heartbreak:  Opportunities lost because it takes an act of I-don't-know-what to get even the smallest thing done at NVCC.  By the time they get around to action, the window has closed.  The tragedy:  Human Resources fails to do its job in every possible way, continuously, in spite of a constant turnover and constant state of reshuffling.  It's as if NVCC's sad philosophy is that if it did not work before, let's change people and positions around and continue to err the same way and see if the results are different.  Also, there is the policy that adjuncts are not paid for labor (such as additional hours toward a specific project, i.e., advising) until several MONTHS after the work is done, in flagrant violation of Virginia employment law.  NVCC's solution:  stop hiring adjuncts to do those jobs and make full-time faculty do them, whether they want to or not.  It's not just HR, but problems penetrate the entire organization.  Anyone with the smallest authority runs their own fiefdom, and woe to someone who needs to work with them to get things done.

review_title: One of the best ways to save money, get good education, and continue your education in the best universities of Virginia
job_title: Math and Science Tutor in Annandale, VA
pros:
- Cheap
- Great professors
- Diversity
- Small size of classes
- Good facilities
- Great financial aid 
- Guaranteed Agreements with UVA, Virginia Tech, and George Mason
cons:
- Poor party scene
- Not enough opportunities for research
- Lack of career and profession opportunities

job_title: Professor, Information Technology in Annandale, VA
pros: Academic freedom within limits.  Supportive administrative staff.  Job security.  Teaching community college students is very satisfying when you feel you've made a connectio and helped a student on his or her way. Decent salary for the 9 month faculty if you stay a while.
cons: Student population contains a broad spectrum of abilities, which makes it difficult to keep the brighter students engaged without leaving behind the students who are slower learners.  The IT labs are a disaster; constant problems with the software we are trying to teach.

review_title: Seeking employment in career counseling, human resources or adult learning
job_title: Student Engagement Coordinator in Annandale, VA
pros: Internal employees are very nice and it's wonderful working with the students, I learned a lot of great skills here.
cons: A lot of instability due to constant restructuring; poor use of employee skill development when necessary.  Employees who have worked hard and care about students do not get rewarded, unfortunately.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Annandale, VA
pros: There is some flexibility in work hours in that you can turn down any class you are asked to teach.  In some cases, you may be able to ask to teach classes at the times/days you prefer. It can be a good job if you've always wanted to teach college, your livelihood doesn't depend on it, and you don’t expect any career advancement. You will get tiny salary increases on a rare occasion (say $50 for a semester once in a while) which is at least better than no increase. The true reward is the feeling that despite all the problems, you are helping to educate students by teaching a subject you love. It’s a good school for students who need to save money on their college education and for those who are the first in their family to attend college and not quite sure of themselves. You can take pride in the job you do, and there more good students than most people might imagine.
cons:
Low pay, no benefits -- that goes without saying for adjuncts. No guarantee of employment from semester to semester and no guarantee of how many hours you will teach in a semester. How you are treated depends on who is running the particular department and what their attitude is toward adjuncts; some treat them as professionals (which they are -- hiring criteria is the same for full and part-time); others consider them disposable. How much you enjoy your job depends on your own enthusiasm for teaching, and to some extent, the students’ willingness to cooperate and do their work; that can vary quite a bit from student to student and class to class.
You will not be hired for a full-time job. The adjuncts who do become full-time are pre-selected, and for a variety of reasons, start teaching before the full-time position is advertised. If you are one of these few people, you will, of course, be hired, and the school can continue to pretend to hire full-time faculty from the adjunct ranks. Because it is a two-year school you will teach the same freshman classes over and over again but will rarely be offered any of the other courses to teach to give yourself the chance to do something a little different once in a while.

job_title: Computer Operation Tech in Woodbridge, VA
pros: Great place to work at. A lot of the people are great. Work with your schedule in most positions for worker development. Very great community vibe.
cons: Politics rules all. Need a paper trail for every small thing that is done on the job so things do not come back on you. Depending on department everyone will hate you or like you.

pros:
It was nice to have the extra income.
My department chair was a nice woman to work for and understood that I needed to work to support my family so she was flexible in allowing me to teach new courses.
No micro-managing of adjuncts.
Management was very understanding when a student became hostile and strange (this actually happened with two different students and management was always very supportive)
cons:
You don't know if you're going to have a job each semester because your job is dependent on student enrollment.
Sometimes students don't work to their full potential.

pros: At NVCC, we ensure an open door policy and meet students from all works of life and cultures. With expertise, faculty work independently and collaboratively to prepare students with life long learning. At NVCC, I am happy in my employment to be a window to our world.
cons: The pros outweigh the cons. Excellent facilitative leadership.

pros: Diverse workforce and student body; I work with lots of smart and nice people. Some flexibility of schedule as those on the instructional design team can set their own hours and are afforded one telecommute day per week.
cons: The politics among the deans and provosts of the various campuses of this very large college sometimes gets in the way of producing desired outcomes.

pros: I will be able to improve my education at anytime. Working and going to school at the same location is advantageous.
cons: The downsides can be challenges. Because of my pass experience in security and my current training with Goodwill and Virginia Metropolitan Training Academy for the Security Job Training Program,  I am well prepare to face any challenges in regard to security.

pros: If you are full-time, access to taking courses that are free
cons: Many of their processes are mired in useless bureaucratic paperwork, so that progress is severely slowed or halted.

review_title: Good for a side job, very difficult to get full-time work.
job_title: Adjunct Professor in Sterling Park, VA
pros: Variety of students. Several locations so exposure to other campus, staff, students, etc. can be enjoyable. If you can't work one semester it isn't a problem.  Just come back when your schedule allows.
cons: Never felt like I belonged because the part-timers are so transient.  No benefits unless you are one of the very few who gets full-time work.

pros: Ability to work and support tomorrow's workforce with training that will impact the world. After serving my country in the Marines, it was quite fitting to serve my local community!
cons: I'm optimistic that greater synergy will become contagious and we will collaborate to provide more talent and while continuing to be a national leader in technology!

pros: Very good place to build career path and wonderful opportunities to extended study. Offer free credit courses for faculties and staff. Flexible schedule.
cons: Too little benefits for adjunct faculty. No retirement plan is offered which is not good for a teaching professional.

review_title: Cooperative, friendly co-workers, below average compensation
pros: Cooperative, friendly, team-oriented workers 'mostly' through the college. Many competent, results driven Assistants.
cons: Pay rate for P-14's is considerably below market rate.  No increases in compensation - it is a steady rate no matter how long you work there.  They give more and more responsibilities without monetary compensation.

review_title: Enjoy working as tutor while you go to school
pros: Awesome, convenient place to work if you are a student. You can choose your own schedule and the subjects to tutor. Good place to enhance your communication skills and leadership
cons: No cons. Working environment is great for success!

review_title: Most people very friendly and nice to work with.
pros: Flexibility. Freedom to express and implement new ideas.
cons: Would be nice to have higher salary.

review_title: A good place for administrative and/or clerical positions.
pros: NVCC offers good benefits. Healt insurance is either COVA Care or Kaiser Permanente. You can have the opportunity to ask for tuition assistance.
cons: I couldn't know how it is in all NVCC, but in the area where I worked, there was a poor team work.

review_title: Assist and support for sudents to achieve their goals in the ejecution of their proyects.
job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Sterling, VA
pros: I love the interaction with creative people. Enjoy to learn something new everyday. The lab have all the tools and programs for Interactive and Graphc Design.
cons: Some times is a down time, but I love to create posters for events in Campus. I always have something in mind to ejecute.

pros:
Students and experience of molding new minds and passing on knowledge.
Flexible schedule
Colleagues are great, for the most part
cons:
Leadership is beyond awful; terrible 
Provosts and President are idiots with no concept of higher education. Sad. They waste money and do not have credentials to do their jobs.

review_title: Hard to Get In, Hard to Move Up
job_title: Continuing Education Instructor in Alexandria, VA
pros:
Great students
Great Supervisor
Beautiful Campus
Freedom to be creative in the classroom
cons:
No room to advance or move around
Once you are in, you can easily be bumped out
Rude and ignorant Department Heads

pros: Flexible hours, allowed me to contact students however I wanted. It was also relatively easy to get hired. You just needed to have a B on a class.
cons: It was hard to find tutees for certain subjects. Many of the classes at NOVA weren't an issue for most students so it was hard to find consistent work.

job_title: Student Services Coordinator DBM in Arlington, VA
pros: Traveling, events, workshop, and working with almost 5 departments in 4 campuses. The best opportunity meeting variety of multi culture students and staff members.
cons: Creating students application database, Student registration and completing students finical aid application, Creating flyers and power point presentations for workshop programs. For more detail, please see resume.

pros: Relaxed environment, tuition assistance, free parking, low stress, on-site galley (so you don't have to leave for lunch), flexible hours. NVCC is a great place to start your career or end it before retiring. I miss the place and wouldn't mind going back.
cons: Pay is on the low side and could be better.

review_title: My longest job, with the widest range of responsibilities and the one where I learned the most, was at NVCC.
pros:
worked under a variety of supervisors
trade and safety seminars
benefits commensurate with college employment (in fact, state benefits)
opportunity to perform a variety of tasks
cons:
ambiguous disciplinary policy
low salary for the position

review_title: Great for people that like stable and repetitive tasks to work on and enjoy decent compensation.
job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Alexandria, VA
pros: Great working environment, relaxed upper management, management works with the employee if there is outside work emergency.
cons: Not a lot of opportunities to move up.

pros: Students are terrific and the intrinsic value is beyond description
cons: Low pay, low morale, financial disarray, no leadership, no discipline (faculty), no incentive to accel. Very poorly managed.

pros: money is at or above standard.  Fairly consistent opportunities for part time work. Flexible schedule
cons: Little chance for advancement. No credible teacher evaluation procedures. Lack of respect for adjuncts. Typical bureaucratic administration which supports administrative staff first, students second, adjuncts last.

review_title: BEST STUDENT HIRE POSITION - developmental Math Lab ALEXANDRIA CAMPUS
pros: Great Management style, team work, flexibility, great coworkers, become proficient at tutoring math, help community college students, great salary in comparison with other student hire and retail jobs
cons: have to know how to teach students with different social and cultural backgrounds

job_title: Trainer and Instructor in Annandale, VA
pros:
1. Good supervisor
2. Fulfilling work
3. Strong professional connections
4. Good communication building opportunities
5. Leadership opportunities
6. Constant learning and career development opportunities
cons:
1. Low pay
2. No opportunity for full-time work
3. High bureaucracy
4. HR is very poorly run
5. Few benefits
6. Students can be difficult to deal with

pros:
Friendly colleagues 
Nice offices 
Interesting students with a variety of backgrounds, needs, and concerns -- kept work interesting.
cons:
Heavy student load and so limited amount of time could be spent with each appointment.
Little to no follow-up with students given the nature of the "walk-in" appointments and heavy load.

pros: The diversity of the student population allows you to meet some interesting people. Great co-workers. Less drama than working at a university.
cons: The college loves to spend money on hiring Vice Presidents that do nothing except take away funding from campus programs.

review_title: Ok Benefits but low salaries and no flexibility
pros: Paid Christmas Break, nice people
cons: Very low salaries, no maternity leave, not much flexibility for the schedule.

pros: Help a variety of people achieve their goals; be prepared to share a wealth of knowledge and information on programs, financial aid, etc. Be connected to all other divisions, outreach, develop plans for retention, recruitment, etc
cons: Often too big to have a good consensus.

pros: they do pay you a bit of a salary. So that is a good thing right?
cons: not enough pay, and they rarely pay on time. Like they make you wait for a heck of a long time.

review_title: Strange place to work at but not bad
job_title: Trainer Instructor I in Sterling, VA
pros: incredibly nice coworkers(depending on the campus and office), easy work schedule, work and life balance.
cons: No two days are the same, students usually are unprepared/unorganized, depending on your office other offices blame you for their inability to complete their job.

review_title: Everyone should want to work here.
pros: The are teacher focused in terms of trust.  They trust that the teacher will do his/her job according to expectations, which is not difficult because it is common sense!
cons: I wished they hired more FTF.

job_title: Student Life Office Specialist in Sterling, VA
pros: I got to work in an amazing department, get to work with students from around the world, get to participate in conferences, gain a lot of friendship.
cons: Poor pay, not a great training  initiative

pros: Its great place to work.
cons: hard to move up in the college

review_title: Provides Support the Benefits Unit for the Department of Human Resources in all areas of Benefits Administration.
pros: I work with a talented people and with deep bench strength in the profession.
cons: It is only part time.

pros: Flexible hours, ability to work using your own methods, friendly coworkers and supervisors
cons: Low pay, lack of hours

review_title: Good place to work and study
pros: Everyone teaches you... you learn from every angle
cons: Some positions are very rigid, and there is very little room for creativity.

review_title: Great place to learn as well as to work
pros: Flexibility of schedule and constant access to additional learning opportunities and classes.
cons: What is an upside can also be considered a downside: There is always another class to take!

job_title: Student Office Assistant in Manassas, VA
pros: You can learn a lot from the experience you gain in working for the Dean of Students Office.
cons: I did not come across any experience I would consider to be a Con.

pros: Opportunities to teach! There are a wide variety of classes available for adjuncts. Good professional development opportunities.
cons: Some students can be very demanding. You have to learn to hold the line. Pay could be better.

pros: Great people to work with, academic freedom, friendly atmosphere
cons: below-market pay, no benefits, policies from top management that make no sense and penalize part-timers, no opportunity for advancement

pros: Great coworkers promote an environment of learning.
cons: Awful pay. Constantly fighting bureaucracy. HR is a complete mess. No chance of ever moving up.

pros: Flexible hours woking with great people.
cons: Cannot work job if not a student at the school.

pros: Ease of work, friendly coworkers, respected institution, time off, benefits
cons: Bureaucratic, campus locations, difficult to advance in your career

job_title: IT Help Desk Analyst in Fairfax, VA
pros: You feel valued at your position
cons: There is no upward mobility.

pros: They work with faculty, staff, and students very well.
cons: Good college to work for among other things.

review_title: My experience so far has been amazing!
pros: Great place to work as a student because of the work load.
cons: Not that much benefits for a work study student.

pros: very friendly work environment, flexible time off
cons: not so competitive salary and no career advancement

review_title: NOVA is a great place to work
pros:
Supportive Staff
Many resources available for Faculty
Great student cultural diversity
cons: None I can think  of.

review_title: As long as your okay not getting promoted
pros: Benefits, state job, nice vacation, summers work schedule is flexible.
cons: They Do NOT promote within, especially if you are not in with the right people or if your not the "right type of person". No room for growth. Constant leadership change. Volatile,

pros: Good institution to work with if you like to engage students in class.
cons: Difficult to find a full-time teaching position

pros: Since it is a big college, there were many courses to teach and various class hours.
cons: Student class scheduling system need more improvements.

pros: great vacation, sick days, personal days etc plus holidays.
cons: besides some employees's attitude and incompetence, i can't think of anything bad to say about nvcc

pros: Great colleagues and nice students
cons: Executives give themselves raises, then fire the people that do the work. The remaining staff have to pick up the slack.

pros: Ability to work on own, design own classes and exams.
cons: Very little mobility, low pay. Sometimes lose classes to full time faculty.

pros: Very flexible schedule! Fair paid, great people, and a great manager.
cons: None, because the work schedule also works with your class schedule.

pros: helpful when I need it. A lot of resources for research.
cons: Low Pay, Students are challenging with questions

pros: Flexible schedule, nice managers, Good opportunity lo learn and to take advice from experienced professionals
cons: there is no way to grow, no raise

job_title: Testing Center Proctor in Loudoun Heights, VA
pros: great work environment, friendly manager. We all work like a family
cons: there is no downside tbh. Everything is great there.

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Sterling, VA
pros: Excellent co-workers very supportive. Place to support some extra projects for NOVA
cons: Some students have problems to log in during virtual lab.

job_title: Financial Aid Assistant in Annandale, VA
pros: Great chance to learn more about higher education
cons: Cost of living is not included in pay rates

review_title: Great and Chill place to work
pros: Chill. Everyone at the center is nice and reasonable. Flexible hours.
cons: Surprise budget changes can affect your payroll

pros: A lot of good people to work with.
cons: Not enough communication with the staff.

pros: Great benefits and leave during holidays/bad weather.
cons: Unless you are part of the top you will never see a promotion.

pros: Interaction with students and get more overview of life.
cons: Read new material every time.

pros: Friendly People/Staff, Good work environment, Laid Back for the most part
cons: Office/school politics can be hard to manage at times

pros: great people, great students and good area
cons: hours. tedious work schedule and commute

pros: none everything was superb! i loved working with everyone

pros: Great places to work, and good if you going to school
